unnormalised: Mumbai, Aug 16 – The BSE Sensex saw a minor dip of 0.2% in early trading today, according to sources. Analysts attribute this to apprehension ahead of the release of Q2 FY24 earnings reports for major IT companies. Infosys is expected to report single-digit revenue growth, while TCS projections remain cautiously optimistic. Experts are keenly watching the performance of the banking sector, particularly SBI, whose NPA figures are a crucial indicator.
normalised: Mumbai, August sixteenth – The B-S-E Sensex saw a minor dip of zero point two percent in early trading today, according to sources. Analysts attribute this to apprehension ahead of the release of Q two F-Y twenty four earnings reports for major I-T companies. Infosys is expected to report single-digit revenue growth, while T-C-S projections remain cautiously optimistic. Experts are keenly watching the performance of the banking sector, particularly S-B-I, whose N-P-A figures are a crucial indicator.

unnormalised: Initial estimates suggest a projected fiscal deficit of 6.4% of GDP, slightly above the government's target of 5.9% for FY25. Tax collections witnessed a growth of 12%, driven largely by GST revenue which crossed the ₹1.6 lakh crore mark. Government expenditure on infrastructure projects is slated to increase by 25% in the upcoming quarter, as detailed in the revised budget presented yesterday.
normalised: Initial estimates suggest a projected fiscal deficit of six point four percent of G-D-P, slightly above the government's target of five point nine percent for F-Y twenty five. Tax collections witnessed a growth of twelve percent, driven largely by G-S-T revenue which crossed the rupee one point six lakh crore mark. Government expenditure on infrastructure projects is slated to increase by twenty five percent in the upcoming quarter, as detailed in the revised budget presented yesterday.

unnormalised: Market watchers are advising caution as volatility is expected to continue until the release of the full financial statements by the end of August. Investors are advised to diversify their portfolios and consider long-term investment strategies amidst the fluctuating economic climate. Trading volume is currently at 1.2 million shares, which is considered moderate for this time of the week.
normalised: Market watchers are advising caution as volatility is expected to continue until the release of the full financial statements by the end of August. Investors are advised to diversify their portfolios and consider long-term investment strategies amidst the fluctuating economic climate. Trading volume is currently at one point two million shares, which is considered moderate for this time of the week.
